intro: Eriogonum shockleyi subsp. longilobum, commonly known as the long-lobed buckwheat, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its branched stems and clusters of small, white to pale purple flowers. The leaves are typically lance-shaped with prominent lobes, and the plant often grows in dry, rocky habitats. It is a member of the Polygonaceae family, known for its distinctive seed structures. This subspecies is adapted to arid environments and plays a role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators.
